alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 5:51PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa and southwest Wisconsin, including the following counties, in northeast Iowa, Clayton. In southwest Wisconsin, Crawford and Grant. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. More showers and storms are pushing through early this evening with another one half to one inch of rain is expected for parts of Clayton, Grant, and Crawford Counties. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Platteville, Prairie Du Chien, Lancaster, Guttenberg, Elkader, Boscobel, Fennimore, Muscoda, Strawberry Point, Dickeyville, Cassville, McGregor, Garnavillo, Bloomington, Marquette, Farmersburg, Volga, Preston, Bridgeport and Georgetown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
